definitions: Pass a thread through the eye of a needle or through the various guides and tension discs of a sewing machine.
Pass something through a narrow or intricate passage.
Follow a path or course that twists and turns.
Connect or interweave various elements or ideas.
examples: She threads the needle with ease.
The river threads its way through the valley.
He threads the wire through the conduit.
The narrative threads together several subplots.
